qas.question: By a UCLA study,how many Seattle residents identify as gay, lesbian or bisexual?
How does the numbers in the gay community rank compared to other US cities?
What city ranked higher in population in the gay community?
What is Seattle's percentage of same sex households?
What is Seattle's ranking for same sex households as compared with the rest of the US?

context: Seattle also has large lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender populations. According to a 2006 study by UCLA, <a0_0>12.9%<a0_0/> of city residents polled identified as gay, lesbian, or bisexual. This was the <a1_0>second-highest<a1_0/> proportion of any major U.S. city, behind <a2_0>San Francisco<a2_0/> Greater Seattle also ranked second among major U.S. metropolitan areas, with 6.5% of the population identifying as gay, lesbian, or bisexual. According to 2012 estimates from the United States Census Bureau, Seattle has the <a4_0>highest percentage<a4_0/> of same-sex households in the United States, at <a3_0>2.6<a3_0/> per cent, surpassing San Francisco.
